content:
What is the syntax for creating a Markdown table with column headers "Name", "Age", and "Gender", and three rows of data with values "John", "25", "Male", "Jane", "30", "Female", and "Bob", "40", "Male"? Please provide a code example.
Here is an example Markdown table using the given data:
| Name | Age | Gender |
|------|-----|--------|
| John | 25  | Male   |
| Jane | 30  | Female |
| Bob  | 40  | Male   |
To create this table in Markdown, you can use the following syntax:
| Name | Age | Gender |
|------|-----|--------|
| John | 25  | Male   |
| Jane | 30  | Female |
| Bob  | 40  | Male   |

To create a Markdown table with the column headers "Name", "Age", and "Gender", and include three rows of data as specified, you can use the following syntax:

```markdown
| Name | Age | Gender |
|------|-----|--------|
| John | 25  | Male   |
| Jane | 30  | Female |
| Bob  | 40  | Male   |
```

This Markdown code will render a table like this:

| Name | Age | Gender |
|------|-----|--------|
| John | 25  | Male   |
| Jane | 30  | Female |
| Bob  | 40  | Male   |

Each row starts with a pipe `|` symbol and ends with a pipe, and each column is separated by a pipe. The dashes `-` below the headers indicate where the header ends and the data begins, ensuring the table is correctly formatted.
